fields.description:
*Current status*
 * Boards are always listed in a dropdown box, even if there are only a few of them in a project

  !boards-current.PNG!

 

*Suggestion*
 * Boards could be listed directly instead of a dropdown box, to make them more accessible
 * This could be made configurable or automatically whenever there is only a smaller amount of boards 
  !boards-suggestion.PNG!
fields.summary: Direct list of boards instead of dropdown box

fields.description:
If you create a new project using the new Agility (beta) project template, wiki markup does not work in either the project description, or in comments. This also means that rich text formatting does not work for those fields in projects using this template.

It should work in both.

Projects that don't use the Agility project template are not impacted by this issue.
fields.summary: Wiki markup does not work in Agility projects

fields.description:
h4. Summary
While switching between sprints via the Active Sprints tab or Sprint Report there is no spinner on the new UI, you don't know if there is any content loading.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new scrum board.
# Create two sprints.
# Open the active sprints tab.
# Switch between the two sprints.

h4. Old UI behavior.
There is a spinner that will let you know that there is content loading.

h4. New UI behavior.
The spinner was not implemented, you don't know if there is any content loading.
fields.summary: New UI have no spinner when switching sprints.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on the Epic in Backlog view, if the sprint is collapsed, JIRA will not automatically expand to show the issues that belong to the epic.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an epic with several issues in it, some in backlog, some in sprint
# Go to Backlog view
# Click on the Epic
# JIRA will then show all issues that are in the epic
#* If the issues are in a sprint, and the sprint is not expanded, it'll not automatically expand and show the issues
#* If the issues are in backlog, it'll show as backlog can't be collapsed.

h3. Expected Results
* The collapsed sprint should be automatically be expanded, and show the issues belonging to the sprint

h3. Actual Results
* The sprint remain collapsed, and is shown like below screenshot:
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clicking Epic in Backlog doesn't automatically expand Sprints to show issues

fields.description:
I need to remove "CLONE" prefix. I dont have access to advanced settings to do this.

 

JIRA: winclap.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Remove "CLONE" Prefix

fields.description: The Agile board "split ticket" function does not support mandatory custom fields (the only field available is Summary).
fields.summary: Add support for custom fields to Agile board "split ticket" function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For Jira Software projects, when the customer clicks on issue in the Board, it will bring up View Issue Pop Up Screen. The Fields are not customizable at present. Hence, if the customer would like to see more detail on the issue, he needs to click on View Full Details link.
h3. Suggested Solution

To add the screen to allow the customer to customize the View Issue Pop Up Screen for Business Project. The screen will allow the customer to add more fields such as Linked Issue field or delete fields.

 
{panel:title=Update 2018-1-24: Resolved}
This issue is resolved. User can add customizable field by the following procedure:
 # open the project settings
 # click Screens
 # select the Scheme for the issue type
 # click the screen link associated to "View issue" operation
 # add the field from the dropdown in the bottom

Though, user cannot change the order of the field shown. 
 Please refer to JSWCLOUD-16538: allow user to reoder the fields shown in the issue detail pop-up of Kanban board for this issue and the workaround.
{panel}
fields.summary: Customizable Field in View Issue Pop Up Screen for Software Project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In small screens, the start sprint modal is not fully displayed. The button "Start sprint" is not visible.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using a 12" (or smaller) and access Jira
# Go to a board's backlog, create a new sprint and add issues to it
# Click the button "Start sprint"

h3. Expected Results
You see the full modal

h3. Actual Results
The modal is not fully displayed, the button "Start sprint" does not appear on it
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
* Press F11 (on Windows machines) or maximize the screen (on Mac machines)
* Use the Zoom Out functionality of the browser (Ctrl - on Windows or CMD - on Mac) to make the button appear on the screen
fields.summary: In small screens, the start sprint modal is not fully displayed.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who utilize both Jira Software and Service Desk in their instances are unable to create Service Desk specific Boards to display their Service Desk Requests without the need of setting a Project Location.
Boards can be created and filtered to a Service Desk Project, however the location can only be a Software Project or a User's Profile

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an option to make Location Optional or include Service Desk Projects

h3. Why this is important
Agile Boards for SD projects should be categorize-able within a project, rather than a person. If a board is assigned to a person, people on that team won't feel like they have ownership over the board.
 
h3. Workaround 
Set the Board Location to a Software Project or User's Profile
fields.summary: Make Board Location an Optional Configuration

fields.description:
Hi,

I cannot figure out how to get a task to automatically read the "Summary" of a task and transition it to another status based on the Summary including a specific string.

 

Can you please help?

 

Thanks,

Michael
fields.summary: Automatically changing Status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you close a sprint in the web interface, and it contains issues that were not completed, then you are prompted to then tell Jira Software where to place those incomplete issues (ie. to the backlog, into an existing future planned sprint, or possibly create a new sprint to add these issues to that).
 However with the current REST API, you can not use any parameter into the endpoint
{noformat}
/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}{noformat}
that would allow you to do this when closing the sprint via REST call.  See [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-sprint-sprintId-put] for complete parameters that are valid for this call.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if the REST API was updated for Agile/Software to include this as a possible option
h3. Why this is important

It would be helpful for integration/automations that handle sprint management to be able to do this same function that end users using the web gui can perform.
fields.summary: When closing a sprint via the REST API, you should be able to indicate where to place the incomplete issues in the sprint

fields.description:
I was wondering if its possible to set a default label if someone uses a specific ticket type.
I can't seem to figure out how to engage this.
 
Please let me know if you can help.

Thanks,
Michael
fields.summary: Default Label for a ticket type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

The user would like to have more control and options relating to the *Epic* functionality, a better Epic Overview that can help to manage the top to bottom projects better. The ability to set priorities on a top-level basis which then goes down to individual tasks scheduled.
h3. Suggested Resolution

The Epic can have added functionality such as:
 * *Epic Description*: In addition to the General Summary, an expandable description to allow further details to be added
 * *Epic Priority*: A priority setting for the epics within the project
 * *Epic Goal Due Date*: A Due date set before a certain task able to mark with a choice of color to signify the difference
 * *Calendar Inclusion*: Able to include and Exclude Epic into a calendar setting. The calendar overview has colored lines over the Days in which it represents the epic's timeline span throughout a particular week. Each Epic will have a choice of color to distinguish from the day of different weeks. This is to organize the workload for all the tasks.

 

*Picture Included to further illustrate the suggestion.*
fields.summary: Epic Overview With Calendar Linking

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Epic Link missing on Scrum Backlog and Issues missing on Active Sprints in Epic type Swimlane.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create Saved Filter containing Epic Link with conditions
eg. "Epic Link" = ABC-123
# Create Board with existing Filter using the created Filter
# On the Board, create Epic Link: ABC-123

h3. Expected Result
# Epic Link shows on the backlog
# Issues are being shown on Active Sprint

h3. Actual Result
# Epic Link are missing from backlog
# Issues isn't visible on Active Sprint

h3. Workaround
Replace the Saved Filter with Key instead
eg. {{Key = ABC-123}}
fields.summary: Missing Epic Links on Backlog and Issues on Active Sprint when selecting Epic type Swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Repository sync gets stuck on 'Sleeping' status due to Github API rate limit

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud and Github

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira with a Github account that has a big repository (e.g. 20k commits)
# Try syncing this repository

h3. Expected Results
Sync will be paused due to the 5000 request per hour limit on Github side. Once 1 hour is passed the sync should continue.

h3. Actual Results
The sync fails due to the limit and so customer needs to contact support.

We set the sync status to 'Failed' and start it again.


h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
- Set the sync to failed (performed by Atlassian Support)
- Start a sync for a single repository
fields.summary: Repository sync gets stuck on 'Sleeping' status due to Github API rate limit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when having the swimlane set to stories there's no way to see the Epic of each story without clicking on them and checking the detailed information.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the epic label to the status of the story inside the swimlane:
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-22 at 11.41.03.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-01-22 at 11.41.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important

This helps the development team to see how the work is progressing on the current Sprint relating to the Epics.

h3. Workaround 

Have the swimlane configured to Epics on a separated board.
fields.summary: Add Epic label to stories swimlane

fields.description:
From the dashboard, I click projects and then I have to choose my project from a list.

In my case, I never have more than 1 project so It would be more user-friendly to just skip the selection menu if there's only one project available.
fields.summary: As a user with only one project, I'd like to go directly to the project without having to choose my project.

fields.description:
Converting an issue to a subtask passes through an entirely needless two page loads in the wizard.

One simply makes you click "Next" while showing no additional information, and the other one asks you to confirm something you've already explicitly confirmed. This is super inefficient and prevents any kind of bulk action here.

Ideally, it would be as simple as a drag-and-drop process in the backlog. But even a less onerous conversion process would help.
fields.summary: Reduce the number of clicks in the "Convert Issue to Subtask" wizard

fields.description:
When issues in the backlog view are updated, the light gray vertical bar on their left-border disappears, causing them to be outdented relative to other issues.

This makes them look different for no good reason, and is confusing.

Refreshing the page resets everything to normal, so the UI change is pretty clearly _not_ intentional.
fields.summary: Issue name misaligned in Backlog view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

When users have 30+ projects and each project has a board, it would be difficult (time consuming) to add a new board column for all those boards.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to add new column to multiple boards at the same time.
fields.summary: A feature to add new column to multiple boards at the same time

fields.description:
When attempting to view the control chart in the reporting section of the WO project I am receiving an error message that says "Duplicate key BA Liberal Arts (Campus) - showing Tuition & Fees tab Jira ticket." All other members of my team see the same error message when attempting to view the chart. We checked to see if there was another "WO" board in our organization and this was not the case.

When I searched issues in the system only one issue shows up. I deleted the issue to see if the error message went away. The message stayed but listed a different issue next to the duplicate key error. Please let me know if you need further clarification.

Justification for "Major" severity: Key members of our leadership team are reviewing the reporting capabilities of Jira. I have reports to generate before my meeting on Wednesday of next week.
fields.summary: Duplicate Key Error Message When Attempting to View the Control Chart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
No status is listed on columns page if the Workflow scheme doesn't have issue types assigned to the workflow.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum/Kanban project
# Create a new workflow scheme
#* It will automatically associate *Jira Workflow (jira)* with *All Unassigned Issue Types*
# Associate the project to the new scheme

h3. Expected Results
The statuses of the workflow are listed on columns page

h3. Actual Results
Statuses are missing on board.

Error on console while loading the project's board:
{noformat}
batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:9966 GET https://assuretec.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json?rapidViewId=29&selectedProjectKey=ACUWS&_=1516379036376 500 ()
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
Edit the workflow scheme and associate each issue type to the workflow.
fields.summary: No status is listed on columns page

fields.description:
An attempt is made to perform a JIRA merge between jira cloud and jira server via a backup.


The backup was created via cloud in the backup manager. The backup was created especially for the option "server". The zip file cannot be read in the jira server application when a restore of the system is running. Even individual projects cannot be imported via restore.

Error: Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.setString] "textvalue" is not a field of

 

Second Error: There was a problem parsing the backup XML file at C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA\import\jira-export.zip: No 'key' field for Issue 12101.
fields.summary: Merge JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The development panel loads strangely and sometimes show incorrect information before being totally rendered.
In some cases, it also shrinks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use a similar JQL to search for issues with dev information:
{code}
development[commits].all > 0
{code}
# Without leaving the search page, open issues and look at the preview on the right side.

h3. Expected Results

The dev panel information should be loaded fine.

h3. Actual Results

Here's a video showing the actual behavior:
  [^panelbug.mp4] 

h3.Workaround

In most of the cases, a re-make of the integration solves the problem.
fields.summary: Development panel is not being rendered properly.

fields.description:
Currently when you do this, it defaults to the last kind of issue created.

At the very least, it should not be "Epic" since Epics within Epics are not allowed by the system, at most, I think you can assume the new task is a Story.
fields.summary: When clicking "Create issue in epic", the issue type in the create issue dialog should be story.
As a Jira Software user, I want Github integration to be more robust to deal with Github API limitation

fields.description: Currently,  it's not possible to change the project that an issue is associated with directly from the mobile app.
fields.summary: As a Jira Mobile User, I would like to change the project that an issue is associated with, directly from the mobile app.

fields.description:
Hi!

Looking at this:

Jira administration > Issues > Issue attributes > Statuses (or Resolutions)

It has to be an easier way to order these lines, for example with drag-and-drop that some functions in Jira already has. Using the arrows on the line of each status or resolution, that seems to be updating the entire page each time, will just take f-o-r-e-v-e-r.

Just a suggestion, thank you.

Best regards,

Johanna
fields.summary: Tedious work when changing the order of statuses or resolutions in the Jira administration of issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Boards are not easily accessible. 
You have to click Search > View all boards.
Differently from Dashboards, Projects and Issues, that you have a button on the homepage.

h3. Suggested Solutions
# Create a button for the Boards on the homepage, making it easily accessible.
 !image-2018-01-17-11-00-29-661.png|thumbnail!
# Create a popover button that displays a list of (recent) boards
 https://cl.ly/1Y1e1r351K2t/Screen%20Recording%202018-04-11%20at%2007.04%20PM.gif
fields.summary: In the new UI, create a button for Boards in the main Jira menu and homepage

fields.description:
Hello, 

Thank you for the update of Jira. Everything looks fine though I got more and more frustrated with the releases screen, specifically "add new release"  functionality.

In previous version this field was on the top of the screen. Now it is on the bottom.

Now to add new release I need  to scroll down to the end of the page. Right now I have over 400 rows and I need to scroll few times because of the specific paging loading.

Please check the attachment for the field I'm talking about.

If this can be configured within our Jira by Admin, please let me know how to do this.

Otherwise, please include this improvement in the next releases.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Releases screen: move field "add new release" to the top
Jira SDK, bug in the squeleton creation for workflow condition/validator/post function
Quick Filters on a board are being deselected when navigating away from Kanban board's page

fields.description:
Hi,  I confess to being a reluctant user of Jira as such my expectations of the tracker interface are not yet aligned with the Atlassian developer ,mindset.

But, there a two capabilities I expect in at tracker accessible on the first page presented having selected an issue to examine.

The ability to search the comments of this bug and the contents of any bug in my group's data.  If you have this ability, I did not find it.  In fact, I found nothing to indicate such a capability.

 

The second feature I have found so useful it is nigh on inseparable from the very concept of tracking: presentation of comments in some form or at least the indication that comments exist.,  A status quo expecting the user to choose the comments tab on a whim to show them whether or not there are comments is not desirable UX design.

As earlier noted, I am in the process of drinking the kook-aid but have not reached the bottom of the cup so there are still virulent reactions to offenses against built-in expectations.

 

Please find it within your galaxy to create these capabilities, or at least make learning of them more obvious to someone other than stewie,  I'm more of a blender.

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Jira bug/tracking main page missing key stats

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Epic Link (or Story Points) field is duplicated after import

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Backup
# Import the backup file
#* If you had one Epic Link field on original instance then you'll have 2 on the instance where the import was done.

h3. Expected Results
The field is not duplicated.

h3. Actual Results
A new Epic Link field is created.
 
h3. Notes
All fields have the same value
It also affects the "Epic Nane" field

h3.Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com] to remove additional fields.
fields.summary: Epic Link field is duplicated after import

fields.description:
Hi,

we're facing an issue on new project creation.

When creating new Jira project, in "people" tab, there is a default reference to an old group, deleted since 6 months (see screenshot) and i'am unable to remove the reference to this group : an error tells me that this group doesn't exist ...

 

How can we solve this issue ?

!image-2018-01-15-18-29-41-184.png!

!image-2018-01-15-18-34-15-732.png!

!image-2018-01-15-18-34-56-414.png!

 

 

!image-2018-01-15-18-35-38-831.png!

since popin message is under tool bar : Browser inspection can help ... ;)

!image-2018-01-15-18-36-10-614.png!
fields.summary: New project make reference to an old deleted group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Portfolio, there can be the following hierarchy level set: *Initiative* > *Epic* > *Story* > *Subtask*

h3. Suggested Solution
The users would like to have the Initiative key showing on the Story Issue card
fields.summary: Add link to the issue card with the Initiative issue key

fields.description:
Right now, the issue detail view will show the estimation field according to the selected board estimation.

Some users may have Epics with Story Points and Sub-tasks with time estimation.

You can't show both fields at same time at the issue detail view, so you will need to choose between show the time estimation or the story points.
fields.summary: Show multiple estimations field at the Issue detail view.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the current Cloud release, we do not have a feature to extract data/report that shows list of users(Jira/Confluence) and which boards they are connected to or which they are contributing with.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a built in feature where users can extract the data

h3. Why this is important
It would be good if we have a build in feature in Jira/Confluence that able to extract that information in a report or perhaps CSV file
fields.summary: Ability to extract data or report that shows which user connected to which boards

fields.description:
The toggl button used to show up on my scrum board page; not it still shows up on issues pages, but not when I am on a scrum board page.

 

!image-2018-01-13-16-30-54-148.png!
fields.summary: Toggl no longer appears on board page

fields.description: As a Jira Software user, I want to see the story points available and points consumed showing on every card in the board as well as totals on each column of story points available/consumed, like how Trello boards work
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to see the story points available and points consumed showing on every card in the board as well as totals on each column of story points available/consumed

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to see issues' status and other fields on the backlog in a different column in the issue card.

*The issues in the backlog should have customizable columns.*

 

   !Screen Shot 2018-01-12 at 15.18.39.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to see issues' status and other fields on backlog in a different column

fields.description:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/viewing-your-system-information-834221020.html]

Access to *System Info* page is restricted to Atlassian only.
fields.summary: Viewing your system information documentation is incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to drag and drop issues after users change any of the Epic color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a board with some issues in it (Epic and Stories)
# Change the Epic color from Epic Panel
# Attempt to drag and drop any issue

h3. Actual result

No issues can be moved (drag and drop), it's just stuck.

h3. Expected Result

Issue can be moved anywhere within the board.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Unable to drag and drop issue after changing Epic color

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inform user that software features are accessible only by licensed users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
this is an example using the View Development Tools permission:
# enable Jira integration with GitHub
# for permission scheme, set "Group: Anyone" to both Browse Projects and View Development Tools
# view the issue by anonymous user

h3. Expected Results
an anonymous user can view the development panel

h3. Actual Results
an anonymous user can't view the development panel

h3. Problem Definition
Access to software features are limited to licensed users though you can set the permission to "Group: Anyone".

So, when you set a permission which requires license(like View Development Tools) to "Group: Anyone", the result will be the same as setting this to "Application Access: Any logged in user"

This is difficult to understand intuitively.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either of the following:
* show a message that setting "User:Anyone" for the permission which requires license will still restrict the access to "Application Access: Any logged in user"
* don't show the "User:Anyone" option for permissions which require software license
fields.summary: Inform user that software features are accessible only by licensed users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing the Release name changes also the release start date and release date.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Expand "Versions" side-menu in backlog
- Click on Arrow next to a version
- Click "Edit name"
- Edit the name
- Now, go to the Releases page

h3. Expected Results
- Release date should remain the same

h3. Actual Results
- Release date gets decremented with every "Edit name" operation described above

Before
 !before.png|thumbnail! 

After
 !after.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66880

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Editing the Release name also changes the Dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create version from Scrum board field limit the version name to 30 characters

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a SCRUM board
# Go to backlog and expand the *Versions* panel
# Click *Create version*
# Type a name for this version

h3. Expected Results
You can type as much characters you want

h3. Actual Results
The version name is limited to 30 characters
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Create versions in the Release tab, which allows longer version names.
fields.summary: Create version from Scrum board field limit the version name to 30 characters

fields.description:
Hi- is there any way to notify myself in slack when I am assigned to a new issue?

 

Thanks!

Michael
fields.summary: Personal Slack Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Boards displaying "ERROR Failed to execute search".

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Software board

h3. Expected Results
Boards are loaded

h3. Actual Results
Logs
{code}
message: Foreground search threw Exception [ http://tkp.to/qcc372iRYZhr ]	
	logger: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.SearchModeExecutor	
 err: {	[-]	
     class: [	[+]	
     ]	
     msg: com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for /* query_source:"JQL SEARCH ABOVE THRESHOLD" */ 
select "ISSUE"."id", /* com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.StringCustomFieldClauseDbQueryFactory */ case when exists (select 1
from "public"."fieldscope" "FIELD_SCOPE"
where "FIELD_SCOPE"."project_id" = "ISSUE"."project" and "FIELD_SCOPE"."issue_type_id" = "ISSUE"."issuetype" and "FIELD_SCOPE"."field_id" = ?) then "cfv10011"."stringvalue" else null end, /* com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.AssigneeDbQueryFactory */ case when exists (select 1
from "public"."fieldscope" "FIELD_SCOPE"
where "FIELD_SCOPE"."project_id" = "ISSUE"."project" and "FIELD_SCOPE"."issue_type_id" = "ISSUE"."issuetype" and "FIELD_SCOPE"."field_id" = ?) then "ISSUE"."assignee" else null end, /* com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.IssueKeyDbQueryFactory */ "ISSUE"."pkey" || '-' || "ISSUE"."issuenum", /* com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.PriorityClauseDbQueryFactory */ case when exists ***************
{code}

UI (error is intermittent)
{noformat}
ERROR Failed to execute search
{noformat}

Console
{noformat}batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jcap=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:6310 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getIssueList' of null
    at D (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jcap=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:6310)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jcap=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:6310)
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.fireWith (batch.js?locale=en-US:77)
    at Object.fire [as resolve] (batch.js?locale=en-US:77)
    at batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jcap=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:5829
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-US:76)
    at Object.fireWith [as rejectWith] (batch.js?locale=en-US:77)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jcap=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:5050)
    at j (batch.js?locale=en-US:76){noformat}
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Boards displaying "ERROR Failed to execute search" and unable to query the DB

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incorrect swimlane count shown in the Kanban board when assignee quick filter used.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Configure swimlanes based on queries (issue does not replicate on other swimlane types)
- Apply the quick filter *Assignee*


h3. Expected Results

The count on the swimlane should match the number of JIRA issues that match the Assignee quick filter.


h3. Actual Results

The count on the swimlane shows that it is not filtered by Assignee.
fields.summary: Incorrect swimlane count shown in the Kanban board when assignee quick filter used

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a Software board, it is not possible to create a board based on an existing configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a feature that provides the ability to create a board based on an existing configuration, like creating a project based on existing schemes.
fields.summary: Ability to create a board based on a template

fields.description:
Several customers have suggested to me that the agile community should rename sprints to relays.  And if enough people agree, Jira should too. 
 * Sprinting conveys a singular focus on speed. Relay focuses on team speak and successful handoffs. #systemsthinking @#devops
 * Sprinting is exhausting. Relays get the best from all but build in time for reflection and recovery. 
 * Sprinting focuses on the finish line. Relays focus on the finish line and the collaboration to get there. 
 * Sprinting treats developers like machines to be optimized and measured above all. Relays treat developers as part of a team collaborating for efficiency, speed, and outcome. 

It is a nuance, and one easily ignored, but for those of us who spend m-f sprinting, it makes a difference.
fields.summary: Rename Sprints to Relays

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Swimlane based on Queries stopped working after editing the default query *Expedite*.
By default Expedite query is on top of Everything Else query. When you edit this default Expedite query, Everything Else becomes on the top and you can't move it back to the bottom.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban Board
# Configure the board to be based on Queries
# Edit the *Expedite* query
# Check the board

h3. Expected Results
Issues are showing in Swimlanes 

h3. Actual Results
Issues are *not* showing in Swimlanes 
 
h3. Notes
You can't manually reorder Expedite to be on top of Everything Else after that
 !expedite.gif! 

h3.Workaround #1
# Delete the Expedite edited query
# Create a new Expedite query, with the JQL you want to use
# Expedite query will be on top of Everything Else and swimlanes will work again.

h3. Workaround #2
# Create a new swimlane with any query, ex: priority = medium
# The newly created swimlane will be placed at the top
# Now you can drag the *Expedite* swimlane to be on top of the newly created swimlane
# Then, you can delete the swimlane which you've created
fields.summary: Swimlanes based on queries stops working when you edit Expedite query

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue type cannot be switched when creating an issue on the agility board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Setup multiple issue types on the issue type scheme used by the agility project.
- Create an issue on the agility board, switch the issue type
-  !choose.png|thumbnail! 




h3. Expected Results

The created issue should be of the chosen issue type.

h3. Actual Results

The created issue does not use the chosen issue type.

 !created.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue type cannot be switched when creating an issue on the agility board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agility board does not use the default issue type configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Go to *Issue Type Scheme* configuration page.
- Configure a default issue type for the scheme used by the agility project.
-  !default.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an issue on the Agility board.


h3. Expected Results
The default issue type will be used.

h3. Actual Results
Another issue type is used for creating the issue.

 !create.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Agility board does not use the default issue type configured

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Kanban project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some custom fields
 # Associate them to the screen asssociated to the issue detail view of Kanban
 # Change their order in the screen settings

h3. Expected Results

The order of the custom fields will change both in the 1) issue detail view accessible from the Issue menu and 2) the Kanban pop-up
h3. Actual Results

The order of the custom fields change only in the 1) issue detail view accessible from the Issue menu
h3. Workaround

Switch to the old issue view and use the old view's settings and configure the board settings
 # click your Profile icon in the bottom left corner
 # click Personal Settings
 # scroll down to the "Jira Labs" section and switch off the New Jira issue view, if available
 ** This switch is available only in certain instances. If you can't see the toggle, you can't use this workaround.
 # return to your board
 # click ... and select board settings
 # click Issue Detail View and customize the order
fields.summary: Allow user to reorder the fields shown in the issue detail pop-up of Kanban board in the new experience

fields.description:
Currently, when setting up columns, it is possible to add a large number of status in a single column. The only available options for grouping these is to use Swimlanes. This can cause a lot of dead space where columns have content in a given swimlane that another column cannot have creating negative space.

It would be a helpful feature to be able to control the order of the status or other fields that they show up in.
fields.summary: Custom Sorting for Kanban Columns

fields.description:
Hi, Is it possible to set priority levels to pre-designated due dates.
For example, when someone selects "Highest", the Due Date automatically populated to tomorrow, "Very high" to 2 days from today etc etc.. ?
 
Thanks,
Michael
fields.summary: Priority level --> due date automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Selecting multiple issues to move them in the rank in the backlog won't work properly in the end. instead of keeping the same order as you've dropped them in, the order won't remain the same after the page refreshes.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select multiple issues:  !Screen Shot 2018-01-08 at 2.00.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Drag them to the top:  !Screen Shot 2018-01-08 at 2.05.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Refresh the page, the order will change:   !Screen Shot 2018-01-08 at 2.00.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The order should remain the same as they were dragged in.

h3. Actual Results
The order changes after refreshing the page (or simply gong to another section and coming back to it).


h3. Workaround
Dragging one by one is working properly.
fields.summary: Changing the rank of multiple issues simultaneously won't work properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira allows issues having both Epic Link and Parent link

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Scenario 1:
{panel}
Initial state:
- Issue: Epic
- Parent link: (/)
- Epic link: (x)

Action: 
- User moves the issue to another project, change its type and add a Epic link.

New state:
- Issue: Story
- Parent link: (/)
- Epic link: (/)

Result: 
- The issue has Parent Link and Epic Link, which is not correct. Epic link is shown on UI but the Parent link is not. Also, if the users opens the parent, the issue is not listed.
{panel}

Scenario 2:
{panel}
Initial state:
- Issue: Story
- Parent link: (x)
- Epic link: (/)

Action: 
- User moves the issue to another project, change its type and add a parent link.

New state:
- Issue: Epic
- Parent link: (/)
- Epic link: (/)

Result: 
- The issue has Parent Link and Epic Link, which is not correct. Parent link is shown on UI but the Epic link is not. If the users opens the parent, the issue is not listed.
{panel}

h3. Expected Results
If the Story already have a Parent Link, Epic Link field shouldn't be available.
When the Story is updated to Epic, the Epic Link should be removed.

h3. Actual Results
Issues ends up having both Epic Link and Parent link
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Jira allows issues having both Epic Link and Parent link

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team,

we had a Pentest and would like to know how to deal with the following results and what type of Support we can have (if any) from Atlassian in here:

 
|Application Error
forging a request that contains parameters or parameter values other than the ones expected by the application
 |Check incoming requests for the presence of all expected parameters and values.|[http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/550.html]|
|Missing Secure Attribute in Encrypted Session Cookie|Basically the only required attribute for the cookie is the "name" field. Common optional attributes are: "comment", "domain", "path", etc. The "secure" attribute must be set accordingly in order to prevent to cookie from being sent unencrypted. RFC 2965 states: "The Secure attribute (with no value) directs the user agent to use only (unspecified) secure means to contact the origin server whenever it sends back this cookie, to protect the confidentially and authenticity of the information in the cookie." For further reference please see the HTTP State Management Mechanism RFC 2965 at: [http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2965.txt] and for "Best current practice" for use of HTTP State Management please see [http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2964]|CWE-522 [http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/522.html]*,* CWE-718 [http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/718.html]*,* CWE-724 [http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/724.html]*,* CWE-928 [http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/928.html]*,* CWE-930 [http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/930.html]*,* PCIDSS-6.5.10|
fields.summary: Missing Secure Attribute in Encrypted Session Cookie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when a board has no columns with a mapped status, no message is shown in the UI and the backlog is simply showing as a blank page. As now, we had to check the network request and see that the JIRA API responded with error "This board has no columns with a mapped status”.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since there is a API response with error "This board has no columns with a mapped status”, this error should be displayed in the UI instead.

h3. Why this is important
This makes it easier for users to understand the root cause of the problem.
fields.summary: Display a message when a board has no columns with a mapped status

fields.description:
Jira search no longer working in our current cloud version:
 * clicking magnifying glass,  entering text and searching just seems to result in display of whatever the last issue was that you  viewed.

Expect this is affecting all Jira Cloud users...
fields.summary: Search not working

fields.description: The project is completed, resources are terminated, all JIRA accounts have been disabled/deleted. We don't want people to be able to have access to jira to view or make any changes, however, we need them to be able to email into the system about new stuff like a bug is found or a new opportunity. Somehow jira allows people with no existing account to email in but not the people with disabled or deleted account.
fields.summary: Users with pre-existing account are unable to email into JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Agile Wallboard gadget is not loading board content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard or use an existing one.
# Add the Agile Wallboard Gadget and select a board.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should load and show all the issues presented on the board.

h3. Actual Results
The gadget does not load any data.
 !wallboard.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard gadget is not loading board content

fields.description:
In the Jira REST API documentation, there is a section explaining the Pagination:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#pagination

This section can be improved if there are some examples how to set a URL, appending a {{&startAt=0}}, similar to this page:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/pagination-in-the-rest-api/

Similar examples in the Jira REST API documentation will help users how to use pagination accordingly.
fields.summary: Improve the pagination examples in REST API documentation

fields.description: The new issue view has moved textboxes to the right side and it does not appear there is a way to re-align them the way they need to be aligned for large input boxes.  Additionally, fields that are defined as rich text are displaying their markdown in the new issue view instead of displaying as rich text.
fields.summary: New Issue View does not display rich text fields as rich text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Remove from sprint adds the issue to a sprint not listed by the board

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On board 1, create a sprint and start it
# Add an issue from backlog of the board 1 to a future sprint in board 2
# Close the issue added to the sprint of board 2
# On the backlog view of board 1
#* Click on a issue in the active sprint (you need to use the old Jira view)
#* Click on the 3 dots button of the issue view (sidebar)
#* Select _Remove from sprint_
#** The issue will be shown under the sprint of the board 2

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be added to the sprint/backlog of the board where the operation was done.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is added to sprints from other boards that are not listed on the board where the operation is being done.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Remove from sprint adds the issue to a sprint not listed by the board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Due to usability preferences, some teams would find a story points action better to use while reviewing an active Sprint or a project backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new action called "Story Points" that would simply ask for a new value for the story points field of the issue being viewed.
fields.summary: Add a story points quick action

fields.description:
In the *New Jira Experience* it would be great to be able to filter the project list to hide old or closed projects at the "Application" level.  To recreate:
 # Go to the Jira instance in the New Experience
 # Select *Projects* on left hand side navigation

From this view I see all projects, even those I have used permissions to disable browsing, It would be great to be able to hide old projects or have an archive feature so the old projects don't clutter the list.
fields.summary: New Jira Experience: Filter Project List to Hide Old/Closed Project

fields.description:
Hi tech Support .

I have 2 problem with forward service .

1 Forward service not always redirect my  Main domain [www.fasuperiordental.com|http://www.fasuperiordental.com/] to [http://www.myestheticdentistry.com/]

 

What I mean , from mobile devises and some other client browsers, forward  service not always redirect my  Main  [www.fasuperiordental.com|http://www.fasuperiordental.com/] to [http://www.myestheticdentistry.com/] 

It still keep me pointed to  my old [www.fasuperiordental.com|http://www.fasuperiordental.com/]

 

2 . after 2-3 days  

Forward service mode all of the sudden turned off from by them-self

Please advise or fix this issue 

 
||Domain||Directory||Redirect Url||Type||Match www.||Wildcard||Actions||
|ALL|[/www.fasuperiordental.com|http://fasuperiordental.com/www.fasuperiordental.com]|http://www.myestheticdentistry.com/|permanent| | |
fields.summary: Forward Service was automatically deleted  from Admin Panel on second day

fields.description:
Problem
It's not possible to bulk issues directly from their Epic.

Suggestion
There could be a bulk button above the issues to make the bulk operation quicker.
fields.summary: Bulk operation button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's not possible to reorder issues in the backlog view after creating a new issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to backlog view of a software project
 # Create an issue using the  "+ Create Issue" option at the bottom of the backlog.
 # Try to reorder the issues.

h3. Another way to Reproduce
 # Turn on the new Jira layout.
 # Go to backlog view of a software project and filter the issues using any existing quick filter.
 # Try to reorder the issues.

h3. Expected Results

The issues are properly reordered.
h3. Actual Results

The drag and drop do not work, therefore you cannot reorder the issues.

h3. Workaround
 * It's possible to reorder the issues again after refreshing the page.
fields.summary: Unable to reorder issues in the backlog view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Sprint Burndown gadget is currently asking for the board twice:
 !gad.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard
# Add a Sprint Burndown gadget

h3. Expected Results

The second text should be "Sprint".
fields.summary: Sprint burndown gadget asks for board twice instead of Sprint

fields.description:
Additionally, we should not be seeing sprints of different boards or projects in the Velocity chart. 
Which is not the case at all times.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want to be able to define the number of sprints to be disabled in Velocity Chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the admin needs to check the total story point of the sprint, he/she need to hover the remaining value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the total story points.

h3. Why this is important
Easier for admin visibility on the total story points.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Display Total Story Points in the Epic Sprint instead of need to hover the remaining point value.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Incomplete issues that are from other boards which share the same sprint are not being moved to the  next target sprint.

However, the incomplete issue count is showing correctly during sprint completion dialogue.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create 2 projects(A & B) with Scrum board for each. The JQLs used are specific to the projects itself e.g. project = PROJA.
 # Create 2 issues in project A and start a sprint(Sprint 1) with the 2 issues.
 # Create 2 issues in project B and specifically assign the issues to the sprint created for project A - manually include "Sprint 1" in *Sprint* field.
 # In project B board, *Sprint 1* should appear with the 2 issues from project B.
 # Go to project A board and create a new sprint from backlog view(Future Sprint).
 # Then, proceed with completing *Sprint 1* from project A board.
 # Note that number for *Incomplete Issues* would be 4 (2 from A and 2 from B).
 # Select *Future Sprint* from the dropdown and complete *Sprint 1.*
 # Note that the 2 issues from project A will be under *Future Sprint* but checking project B board, the 2 issues it has will be under *Backlog*.

h3. Expected result

With the number of incomplete issue is correctly shown, *Future Sprint* should have 4 issues from both projects instead of just the issues from the project where the sprint has been completed.
h3. Current result

All other boards' issues are moved to backlog.
fields.summary: Incomplete issues from other boards are not being moved to the next sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While having the new issue detail view active when saving a comment through a JIRA board an using an issue key JIRA will save the comment as plain text instead of referring the actual issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board.
# Create two issues, PROJ-1 and PROJ-2 for example.
#  While having the new issue detail view enabled, comment on issue PROJ-2 the following text:
{code}
PROJ-1
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The comment should be saved linking the PROJ-1 ticket in JIRA.
!comm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

The comment is saved as plain text:
!com.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Disable the new issue detail view under your profile.
 !labs.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When commenting an issue-key to an issue through the board JIRA doesn't identify it as a link.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Date format error when trying to start sprint while using Portugese/Czech due to capital letter in the month abbreviation.
{noformat}
'19/Jan/18 12:39 PM' não é uma data válida. Por favor insira a data no seguinte formato: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a
{noformat}
!portugese_month.PNG!

 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Login to an instance.
 # Change language in profile preferences to Portugese/Czech language.
 # Create a sprint.
 # Start the sprint by selecting *End Date* to be at any date in any month.

h3. Current result

Error is thrown mentioning the date selected is invalid.
h3. Expected result

The month abbreviation should be returned in all lowercases and sprint can be started.
h3. Workaround
 # Select *Custom* instead of default duration.
 # Set the date accordingly.
 # If the *Custom* selection is defaulted back to one of the template duration, change the minute by a few to avoid the revert.

*OR*
 # Set profile language to English temporarily.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Change profile language back to Portugese/Czech.

(i) This affect start date as well if the date is edited.
fields.summary: Date format error when trying to start sprint while using Portuguese and Czech

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
In the old UI, the board's page is failing to load the menus

h3. Steps to Replicate
Use JIRA Cloud
Use Internet Explorer 11
Create 1 test boards
Create some issues on this board
Visit the Agile Boards on IE11


h3. Expected Result
Agile Board page is completed loaded

h3. Actual Result
The menus fail to load

 !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 19.54.19.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2017-12-21 at 19.55.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Use a different browser
* Enable new Jira UI
fields.summary: Board's page is failing to load in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description: When viewing the backlog and attempting to move a task from the bottom of the backlog to the top using the chrome browser, If I right click the bottom-most ticket (the one at the bottom of the browser window), I can see the right-click context menu show up at the top of the browser window. Only the bottom half is visible. If I right-click on a ticker towards the middle to the top of the screen, no context menu is visible. Presumably, it is being told to display in a location that is off-screen?
fields.summary: Right click context menu on backlog getting pushed off

fields.description: Jira now causes Safari 11.0.2 (13604.4.7.1.3) on MacOS High Sierra 10.13.2 (17C88) to run the fans and CPU very high due to a javascript process running like crazy.
fields.summary: Jira causes Safari 11.0.2 to run CPU at 100 %

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Search box in Releases resize and overlapped when user click in the box in the new Jira experience
 !release-search.JPG|thumbnail! 
 !release-search-1.JPG|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to *Releases* on software project and click on the search box

h3. Expected Results
Search box size stay the same 

h3. Actual Results
Search box in *Releases* resize and overlapped
fields.summary: Search box in Releases resize and overlapped when user click in the box in the new Jira experience

fields.description:
Could it be possible to restrict access to time spent information in issues, exports, activity tab & history tab for clients ?

Today, even if we block access to worklog to certain users groups, they can access to these information by having a look at the activity or history tab, or by exporting issues, or displaying "time spent" in dashboard gadgets. It should be blocked everywhere.
fields.summary: Restrict access to time spent

fields.description:
h3. Pls just see my screenshot. Its the same in all browser. No Board, just a strange movement from the Jira info on the buttom to the top. Its happens just to admin users. We didnt change anything in the system.

7.4.2 Server
fields.summary: "View all boards" looks strange

fields.description: When selecting the Issue menu from the top navigation bar, the last 5 issues searched for is shown, as well at the user's top 10 favorite filters.  My suggestion is to add the last 5 filters viewed.  As a Jira Admin, I am constantly working with users on filters and many times they don't name their filters in a way that makes them easy to find later.  It would be very helpful to have that Recently Viewed list, similar to the way the Boards menu shows the most recently viewed boards.  Thank you.
fields.summary: Add a list of last 5 filters in the Issue drop down

fields.description: We used to be able to create a filter in Issue Navigator and click the Details link directly to set the permissions and subscribe or unsubscribe.  Now it appears we have to pull down the Issue menu, go to the manage all filters area, search for the filter and only then can we manage the details.  This is really a pain and will further discourage people from using the features in Issue Navigator, relying on System Admins to do everything for them.
fields.summary: Bring back the link to view and manage Filter permissions and subscriptions in search

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a branch from JIRA (which included an issue key number in its name), there is delay until the branch shows up in the Development panel.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud - This has been reported by customers and also been reproduced in my test instance by creating a branch in a Bitbucket Cloud repo.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in a JIRA instance that is integrated with a Bitbucket account/team
 # Select create branch
 # Create a branch in a Bitbucket repo (branch's name includes the issue key number)

h3. Expected Results

The branch should show in the Development panel.
h3. Actual Results

There is delay until the branch shows up.
h3. Notes
 * Syncing the repo manually from DVCS accounts doesn't seem to help.

 * We also noticed the following: after creating a branch, if we then create also a commit (in this or in any other brach) which includes the issue key number, then the branch (along with the commit) will show in the development panel.
 * There are occurrences where the branch counter doesn't reflect the correct number of branches linked to an issue e.g. 1 branch linked won't be shown until second branch get linked to the issue but the counter will show 1 branch instead of 2 and so on (n - 1 scenario).
fields.summary: Branches created from JIRA don't show up immediately in the development panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira Experience, there is a change in how Quick Filters appear in boards:
* In old Jira: quick filters appear as a clickable link on top of the boards
* In new JIra: quick filters appear as a dropdown. You need to click on the dropdown, and then only you can see and click on the quick filters.

h3. Why is this important
This new change adds an extra click for the customer, and no longer as it used to be. This is especially impactful when a user is using a touch-screen only machine, where keyboard shortcuts can be used.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back how quick filters look in old Jira, or perhaps provide users an option to either show dropdown or show list like the old ways.
fields.summary: Bring Back the Ability to See Quick Filters on Top of Boards instead of Dropdown

fields.description:
When opening any board configuration page the following error will be logged on the browser console and the page will load all sections at once except for Issue Details View.

{code}Uncaught Error: GH.RestfulTable: Init failed! The table you have specified [#ghx-detail-view-field-table-details] cannot be found.
 at s.initialize (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:79)
 at s.t.View (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:64)
 at new s (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:64)
 at Object.GH.DetailViewConfig.renderConfigurationTable (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:623)
 at Object.GH.DetailViewConfig.renderConfig (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:623)
 at Object.GH.DetailViewConfig.init (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:623)
 at Object.GH.RapidBoard.Config.renderEditScreen (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:161)
 at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true:161)
 at j (batch.js:76)
 at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (batch.js:77){code}


When trying to change the name of the impacted boards we get the error "The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.".

Workaround
Disabling the new issue detail under your user profile fixes the problem.
fields.summary: Boards configuration page is throwing errors and rendering all sections

fields.description:
In kanban board, Archive button is wrongly translated to Version.

 

Customer requested for this to be corrected
fields.summary: Incorrect translation for Archive in French

fields.description: The logo is misaligned in the the left nav bar. There is a "margin-left: 4px". When removed resolves the alignment issue.
fields.summary: Jira logo misaligned

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User of GitHub cannnot view the Development panel even if anonymous access is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# enable Jira integration with GitHub
# for permission scheme, set Group: anyone to both Browse Projects and View Development Tools
# view the issue by anonymous user

note: public access is allowed for the GitHub repository

h3. Expected Results
an anonymous user can view the development panel

h3. Actual Results
an anonymous user can't view the development panel
 
h3. Notes
This is reproducible using Bitbucket integration, too.

h3.Workaround
none
fields.summary: User of GitHub cannnot view the Development panel even if anonymous access is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you update your settings in _JIRA Administration > System > Global Configurations > Advanced Settings_ and change the value of *jira.date.time.picker.java.format* you won't be able to start new Sprints in Jira Software because the End date won't reflect the changes you made in the Advance Settings.


h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to _JIRA Administration > System > Global Configurations > Advanced Settings_
#  In *jira.date.time.picker.java.format*, change the default value to MMM/dd/yy h:mm a
# Try to start a sprint

h3. Expected Results
It should show the value in the new format, just like it is in the Start date.

h3. Actual Results
The End date won't be in the new format, therefore it will cause an error when you click *Start*
 !start-sprint.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Also, if you click on the date picker of the Start date, it will show a wrong year (1939).
 !start-sprint-date-picker.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# Use a custom duration and fill in the End Date field manually
# In _JIRA Administration > System > Global Configurations > Advanced Settings_ click *Revert* to go back to the default settings.
fields.summary: Sprint End Date is not updated by the jira.date.time.picker.java.format setting in Advanced Settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User has noticed there is a translation error on the navigation bar for Software Projects when using Norwegian Language.

 
h3. Environment:
Windows OS
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to the instance
 # Set the Profile or System language to Norwegian
 # Open any Jira Software project
 # Check the navigation bar for Issues.
 !norwegian.png|width=566,height=477!

h3. Expected Results

To be able to view the Issues option in Norwegian properly and clearly.
h3. Actual Results

Issues option has HTML error in it  in Norwegian Language. There is a HTML tag <u> </u>
fields.summary: Norwegian Language Translation has HTML Error for Issue Tab in Navigation Bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Software Cloud*. Using *Jira Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16477].
  {panel}

Recently I raised a topic with this question

[Is it possible to activate Epic panel on Kanban Board (not Backlog board)?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-it-possible-to-activate-Epic-panel-on-Kanban-Board-not/qaq-p/686059?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic]

But the answer was negative.

So, please add a possibility to activate Epic panel on Kanban board.

h3. *Problem Definition*
We use Kanban board for support tasks for our different products (web sites).  We can't filter all on-going tasks on the Kanban board by separate product.  
In our case One product (web site) = One epic.   Epics are hidden from Kanban board, because of using of Backlog Board.

h3.*Suggested Solution*
To add an Epic panel to Kanban board as it is presented in Backlog board

h3.*Why this is important*

It will be very convenient to use JIRA, if you use one project for a lot of products.   

 !boards.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add an Epic Panel to Kanban Board (not Backlog board)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Boards" dropdown menu used to appear on top of the page, but this option is no longer there in the new Jira experience

h3. Environment
* new Jira experience

h3. Notes
If you have direct URL, the page is accessible. It's just that the option to access it is not anywhere on the UI.

h3.Workaround
Directly access it through https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/secure/ManageRapidViews.jspa
fields.summary: Unable to find list of boards in the new Jira experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the new Agility projects are created using the System Default Configuration Scheme. At many times, customers are using this System Default Configuration Scheme for scrum projects where some fields are set as *Required*. The customer would like to have the option to change the field configuration scheme used for the Agility projects

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to change the field configuration scheme used in Agility projects
 
h3. Workaround 
Modify the System Default Configuration Scheme to be as you would like for the Agility projects. Change the field configuration scheme for the scrum projects
fields.summary: Agility projects: Add possibility to choose specific field configuration scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to delete a board within your profile doesn't work

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 
* New JIRA UI Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to your Profile
# Create a board located in your profile (or browse to an existing board located in your profile)
# Click on the Menu button next to the profile name
# Click on Delete

h3. Expected Results
 * A pop-up of the Deletion prompt allows you to delete the project

h3. Actual Results
 * Nothing happens and the screen is blank

h3.Workaround
Delete board within the "View All" section of the instance
fields.summary: Attempting to delete a board within your profile doesn't work

fields.description:
Currently, if I try to add an issue to the epic using the epic view, I only can add new issues to it.
I want to be able to add existing issues to an epic using the epic view.

 !a.png|thumbnail! 
 !b.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to add existing stories to an epic through the epic view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description 

For some reasons, all columns are deleted in column configuration; causing no issues shown in a board. There is no error or message informing users about that.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Provide clear message when no column exist in board.
fields.summary: Provide clear message when no column exist in board
